results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This series looks at the forgotten cultures where goddess-worshipping religions were prevalent, civilisations which were egalitaran and were based on human cooperation.

results.title: Goddess remembered
results.creator_credit: Donna Read, Magaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This stunning and poetic documentary is a salute to 35,000 years of pre-history, to the solid values of ancestors only recently remembered, and to our ancient goddess-worshipping religions. Archaeologists and anthropologists are beginning to discover evidence of a widespread early civilisation based primarily on human co-operation. This epsiode reveals these forgotten cultures - taking us from ancient caves in France to the sun-drenched palaces at Delphi and Crete. There is also a discussion among well-known scholars such as Merlin Stone and Jean Bolen, who propose a return to a belief in an interconnected life system, with respect for the earth and the female.

group_works.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
group_works.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)

results.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
results.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women’s Decade”.
Four heads of permanent missions to the United Nations discuss the issues of women’s rights. 1976-1985 has been designated as the United Nations decade for women, and a female journalist interviews these four male ambassadors about aims for this decade.

results.title: A Woman's place is...
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
This film was made during the International Women’s Year, 1975 and focuses on Sweden as an example of committed government using the full range of tools at its disposal in a real attempt to give substance to equality for women as set down in the United Nations Charter. Discusses women’s role in the workforce, sexism in the advertising world, men’s role in parenting and sharing house duties, educating primary aged children about gender roles and stereotyping, and basically highlighting the need for equality in all areas of life. Narrated by Joyce Gordon.

results.title: The People's choice
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made in the International Women’s Year, 1975, this film provides an overview of women politicians running for office in several South American countries. Also contains interviews with the general public about the attitudes towards women in politics. Narrated by Rita Moreno.

results.title: The Hidden asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
The developing countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America are mainly agricultural, with 85 percent of their people living on the land. Half of all this manpower is womanpower. But so far women’s economic contributions have been largely ignored while their labour has been taken for granted. The women of Sri Lanka are attempting to change this.

results.title: Equality and development
results.creator_credit: Mark Robbins, Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made during International Women’s Year, 1975, this film is about an International Women’s Forum discussing equal rights for women. In Tunisia, small changes have begun, but more is needed. Women need more education, and employment opportunities; to eradicate illiteracy and teach family planning. The cities and amusements belong to the men - this is to be changed.
